Song.title: O Come, All Ye Faithful
Song.copyright: Words & Music by Frederick Oakeley, John Francis Wade Public domain

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: O [D]come, all ye [A]faith[A7]ful, [D]Joy[A]ful [D]and [G]tri[D]um[A]phant, O [Bm]come [A]ye, [E]O [A]c[ D/B]ome [A/C#]ye [D]to [A]Be[E E/G#]-thle[A A7]hem; [D]Come [G]and [D]be[G]hold [D]Him, [A]Born [D]the [Bm]King [E7]of [A - E/G#]ang[A7]els
Chorus: O [D]come, [A]let [D]us [A]a[D]dore Him, O [D]come, [A]let [D]us [G]a[D]dore [A]Him, O [G]come, [D/F#]let [Em]us [D]a[A]dore [G Em]Him, Ch[D A A7]rist, the [D]Lord.
Verse 2: [D]Sing, choirs of [A]an[A7]gels, [D]Sing [A]in [D]ex [G]ul [D]ta [A]tion, O [Bm]sing [A]all [E]ye [A]ci [D/B] ti [A/C#]zens [D]of [A]he[E E/G#]a----v'n a[A A7]bove; [D]Glo[G]ry [D]to [G]God, [D]all [A]Glo[D]ry [Bm]in [E7]the [A - E/G#]high[A7]est;
Verse 3: [D]Yea, Lord, we [A]greet [A7]Thee, [D]Born [A]this [D]hap[G]py [D]morn[A]ing, O [Bm]Je [A]sus, [E]to [A D/B]Thee [A/C#]be [D]all [A]glo[E E/G#]ry [A A7]giv’n; [D]Word [G]of [D]the [G]Fa[D]ther, [A]Now [D]in [Bm]flesh [E7]ap[A - E/G#]pea[A7]ring
(18th Century)
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 o come all ye faithful joyful and triumphant o come ye o come ye to bethlehem come and behold him born the king of angels chorus o come let us adore him o come let us adore him o come let us adore him christ the lord verse 2 sing choirs of angels sing in ex ul ta tion o sing all ye ci ti zens of heavn above glory to god all glory in the highest verse 3 yea lord we greet thee born this happy morning o je sus to thee be all glory givn word of the father now in flesh appearing 18th century

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: O [D]come, all ye [A]faithful, [D]Joy[A]ful [D]and [G]tri[D]um[A]phant, O [Bm]come [E7]ye, O [A]co[D]me [A]ye [D]to [A]Be[E7]thle[A A7]hem; [D]Come [Em]and [D]be[Em]hold [D]Him, [A]Born [D]the [Bm]King [E7]of [A]angels
Chorus: O [D]come, [A]let [D]us [A]a[D]dore Him, O [D]come, [A]let [D]us [G]a[D]dore [A]Him, O [Em]come, [D/F#]let [G]us [E]a[A]dore [D G]Him, [D]Chri[A]st, the [D]Lord.
Verse 2: [D]Sing, choirs of [A]angels, [D]Sing [A]in [D]ex[G]ul[D]ta[A]tion, O [Bm]sing [E7]all ye [A]ci[D]ti[A]zens [D]of [A]heav[E7]en a[A A7]bove; [D]Glo[Em]ry [D]to [Em]God, [D]all [A]Glo[D]ry [Bm]in [E7]the [A]highest;
Verse 3: [D]Yea, Lord, we [A]greet Thee, [D]Born [A]this [D]hap[G]py [D]morn[A]ing, O [Bm]Je[E7]sus, to [A]The[D]e [A]be [D]all [A]glo[E7]ry [A A7]giv’n; [D]Word [Em]of [D]the [Em]Fa[D]ther, [A]Now [D]in [Bm]flesh [E7]ap[A]pearing
(18th Century)
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 o come all ye faithful joyful and triumphant o come ye o come ye to bethlehem come and behold him born the king of angels chorus o come let us adore him o come let us adore him o come let us adore him christ the lord verse 2 sing choirs of angels sing in exultation o sing all ye citizens of heaven above glory to god all glory in the highest verse 3 yea lord we greet thee born this happy morning o jesus to thee be all glory givn word of the father now in flesh appearing 18th century

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: Adeste fideles læti triumphantes, Venite, venite in Bethlehem. Natum videte Regem angelorum
Chorus: Venite adoremus Venite adoremus Venite adoremus Dominum.
Verse 1: O [D]come, all ye [A]faithful, [D]Joy[A]ful [D]and [G]tri[D]um[A]phant, O [Bm]come [E7]ye, O [A]co[D]me [A]ye [D]to [A]Be[E7]thle[A A7]hem; [D]Come [Em]and [D]be[Em]hold [D]Him, [A]Born [D]the [Bm]King [E7]of [A]angels
Chorus: O [D]come, [A]let [D]us [A]a[D]dore Him, O [D]come, [A]let [D]us [G]a[D]dore [A]Him, O [Em]come, [D/F#]let [G]us [E]a[A]dore [D G]Him, [D]Chri[A]st, the [D]Lord.
Verse 2: [D]Sing, choirs of [A]angels, [D]Sing [A]in [D]ex[G]ul[D]ta[A]tion, O [Bm]sing [E7]all ye [A]ci[D]ti[A]zens [D]of [A]heav[E7]en a[A A7]bove; [D]Glo[Em]ry [D]to [Em]God, [D]all [A]Glo[D]ry [Bm]in [E7]the [A]highest;
{new_page} Verse 3: [D]Yea, Lord, we [A]greet Thee, [D]Born [A]this [D]hap[G]py [D]morn[A]ing, O [Bm]Je[E7]sus, to [A]The[D]e [A]be [D]all [A]glo[E7]ry [A A7]giv’n; [D]Word [Em]of [D]the [Em]Fa[D]ther, [A]Now [D]in [Bm]flesh [E7]ap[A]pearing
Chorus: O [D]come, [A]let [D]us [A]a[D]dore Him, O [D]come, [A]let [D]us [G]a[D]dore [A]Him, O [Em]come, [D/F#]let [G]us [E]a[A]dore [D G]Him, [D]Chri[A]st, the [D]Lord.
(18th Century)
